column4: hey guys. How can i export some .c and .h file which i donwloaded via Firefox to my system that i can use them with make?
Those are source files. What are you trying to do ultimately?
That are librarys (sourcefiles) to programm microcontrollers.
so, can you help me?
I still have no idea what you are trying to accomplish
Did these files come with a Makefile? If not, you will likely want to build them with gcc..
What does the code produce? Device driver?
did you try gparted with your cruzer?
thath worked for me
Yes, but it doesn't show this as a partition
did you try to create new partitiontables too?
Yes, it works fine. Just that when you plug it in, it reports a new cd drive with this data in it
okay, maybe you have a newer version, my cruzer is a few years old.
I'm debating on whether or not it's worth it to remove, after all it's only 6.6MB out of 8GB
i think that the space isn't the problem, it's just gay when it mounts every time a CD, dosn't it ;)
Yea and it makes the system think there was a disk inserted, etc. Kinda lame
indeed.
i never bought a sandisk stick again.
Also I think it works just fine without this software in the OS it's intended for
what? is the new curzer shitsoftware supporting linux ubuntu??
Well you probably should be careful about your language here
The software that ships with these things usually target a particular known os, no names mentioned :P
am i right that some devices need sudo to umount?
You should use privileges when mounting/unmounting nodes
